reviewText: The prospect of a Wham DVD quite excited me but the fact that the price is a bit steep and that all of the Wham videos are not on the set disturb me a bit.  As others have mentioned no "Bad Boys," and most of all no "Careless Whispers."  "Careless" was featured on Wham's album so it should be on this set.  Considering the fact that it's less that 10 videos, the price doesn't match up to the content but a Wham fan would like this DVD, I did.
summary: Not complete but okay for a fan
Title: N/A

reviewText: I gave this DVD 4 stars only because it was nice to see videos that I hadn't seen since I was a teenager, but still it was lacking. Besides the missing videos, "Bad Boys", "A Different Corner", and "Careless Whispers", there were no extras, no interviews, no photo gallery, nothing. There weren't even any liner notes except for a huge fold-out advertisment of other Sony videos.  This DVD seems like nothing but a quick money maker for the company. The videos were just thrown together in random order and the "interactive menus" were bland. Maybe we'll get a bettet video compilation in the future.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ha, ha..., listen up people; this Wham DVD collection can only simply be described as --- In The Key Of "M and "J"..., Michael Jackson that is...; and I say that because not only was the sound of Wham classic in it's distinctive quality and style, but they had a certain mystique about them that depicts 'magic' and sensationalism like that of Michael Jackson. Just watch and listen George on "Everything She Wants" and "Last Christmas". Ahhhh...., "magic"! 'Course don't forget, Andrew Ridgely was nothin' short of George Michael's protoge. I just totally loved them and still love them to this day, though the group is no more. I definitely give this a "5 Star" rating, despite all what those other whinners are rambling about the DVD compilation is missing a couple other great videos. This is great stuff by Wham..., period!  And, I'm grateful to Sony for a fantastic job. My favorite 'joint' on the DVD is "Everything She Wants", because of the way it was shot and produced and especially the extended version of the song itself. Beautiful rendition, beautiful stuff!  Thanks guys. Thank you. Ahhh!
summary: In The Key Of "M" and "J"..., Michael Jackson that is...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great music, great video, makes you get up and dance and sing...wish that there had been more of theirs, but will take these as a start.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although I'm THRILLED that this DVD exists, I must say that it's quite disappointing that the "Bad Boys" video is not on here (it's available on the sure-to-be-now out of print VHS tape "Wham! The Video").  I really can't see why Sony Music Video has been doing such an UNTHOROUGH job on some of their releases!  (New Kids On The Blocks' DVD is missing a video or two too.)  This DVD also has an annoying sequence: it starts with the first videos, jumps to the last videos, then the videos that were skipped are at the end.  Why not just put them in the order of their release so that we can see the evolution of Wham!?  Sure, I can program my DVD player to play them in whatever order I want, but it's just the principle of it!  Do it right, Sony!  Having said all of that, the picture looks crisp and clear.  The sound has been remastered in dolby digital 5.1 surround sound and it sounds great.  Also included are a discography and lyrics in English and French.  There could have been a lot more extras (maybe some stuff from "Wham! In China" which I'm sure willl never come out on DVD; or maybe other archival live footage from TV shows, interviews, etc.)And if you're wondering where the videos for "Careless Whisper" and "A Different Corner" are- you can find those on the "Ladies And Gentleman: The Best Of George Michael" DVD (even though they were recorded during George's Wham! days, they were considered to be solo songs.)And yes, the video for "Young Guns" is missing from this collection.
summary: Hey!  Where's The Bad Boys Video?  Woo-woo!

reviewText: I'll get straight to the point... no "Bad Boys", no "Young Guns (Go For It)", no "Careless Whisper", no "A Different Corner". I am quite cheesed off. I realise that "Careless Whisper" and "A Different Corner" are technically solo hits for George but they ARE on Wham! albums. As a matter of fact, "Careless Whisper" was released as Wham! (featuring George Michael). Please don't get me wrong; I love George Michael and I love Wham! but I just wish that there was more substance to this DVD compilation. I would love to have a commentary by George AND Andrew (they still talk, you know) and a making of some of the videos, maybe "Blue - Live In China" or ANYTHING live. Yes, I realise that the "Everything She Wants" video is "live" but it is just the studio version dubbed over a live video segment. Unfortunately, this is what happens when Columbia/Sony Records releases a Wham! DVD without George Michael's input. Well, that's all for now. Ciaoooooooooooooooooooooo!
summary: Where's the rest of the best?
Title: N/A
